page.text: United Nations
This record contains the original text of speeches delivered in English and interpretations of speeches
delivered in the other languages. Corrections should be submitted to original speeches only. They
should be incorporated in a copy of the record and be sent under the signature of a member of the
delegation concerned, within one month of the date of the meeting, to the Chief of the Verbatim
Reporting Service, Room C-178.
Corrections will be issued after the end of the session in a
consolidated corrigendum.
Fifty-third Session
st plenary meeting
Tuesday, 15 December 1998, 10 a.m.
New York
President:

text.i: The meeting was called to order at 10.20 a.m.

page.text: The Acting President: This morning, the General
Assembly will consider the reports of the Second
Committee on agenda items 91 to 98 and 12. I request the
Rapporteur of the Second Committee, Mr. Uladzimir Gerus
of Belarus, to introduce the reports of the Second
Committee in one intervention.
Mr. Gerus (Belarus), Rapporteur of the Second
Committee: It is my honour to introduce the reports of the
Second Committee to the General Assembly. I take pleasure
first in introducing the report of the Second Committee on
agenda item 12, entitled "Report of the Economic and
Social Council", which the Assembly has before it in
document A/53/605.
Paragraph 18 of that document contains three draft
resolutions, and paragraph 19 contains two draft decisions
recommended by the Committee for adoption by the
Assembly.
The Assembly also has before it the report of the
Second Committee on item 91, entitled "Macroeconomic
policy questions", in document A/53/606 and addenda 1
to 5. Document A/53/606 contains the introduction to the
item.
The
report
on
sub-item
"Trade
and
development", is contained in document A/53/606/Add.1.
Paragraph 10 of that document contains two draft
resolutions, and paragraph 11 contains one draft decision
recommended by the Committee for adoption by the
Assembly.
Under
sub-item
entitled
"Financing
of
development, including net transfer of resources between
developing
and
developed
countries",
the
Second
Committee, in paragraph 10 of document A/53/606/Add.2,
recommends the adoption of two draft resolutions, and in
paragraph 11 the adoption of one draft decision.
In paragraph 7 of document A/53/606/Add.3, the
Second Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of one draft resolution under sub-item (c),
"Commodities".
I would like to bring to the attention of the
Assembly a small correction to operative paragraph 24 of
the draft resolution contained in paragraph 7 of document
A/53/606/Add.4, submitted under sub-item (d), "External
debt crisis and development". In operative paragraph 24,
on line 4, the word "including" should be inserted after
the word "resources". With this small correction, the
Committee recommends to the Assembly the adoption of
this draft resolution.
In paragraph 6 of document A/53/606/Add.5, the
Second Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of one draft resolution which is not related
General Assembly
91st plenary meeting
Fifty-third session
15 December 1998
to any specific sub-item. This draft resolution is entitled
"Role of the United Nations in promoting development in
the context of globalization and interdependence".
The General Assembly also has before it the report of
the Second Committee on agenda item 92, entitled
"Sectoral policy questions", which is contained in document
A/53/607. Paragraph 14 of that document contains one draft
resolution under sub-item (a), "Business and development",
and one draft resolution under sub-item (b), "Industrial
development
cooperation",
which
the
Committee
recommends for adoption by the Assembly.
Under agenda item 93, "Sustainable development and
international economic cooperation", the Assembly has
before it the report of the Second Committee contained in
document A/53/608 and addenda 1 to 7. Document
A/53/608 contains the introduction to the item and a list of
documents before the Committee.
In paragraph 6 of document A/53/608/Add.1, the
Second Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of one draft resolution under sub-item (a),
"Implementation of and follow-up to major consensus
agreements on development".
Under sub-item (b), entitled "Integration of the
economies in transition into the world economy", the
Second Committee recommends to the General Assembly,
in paragraph 5 of document A/53/608/Add.2, the adoption
of one draft resolution.
In paragraph 10 of document A/53/608/Add.3, the
Second Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of one draft resolution, and in paragraph 11,
the adoption of one draft decision under sub-item (c),
"Implementation of the outcome of the United Nations
Conference on Human Settlements (Habitat II)".
Under sub-item (d), "Renewal of the dialogue on
strengthening
international
economic cooperation
for
development through partnership", in paragraph 9 of
document
the
Second
Committee
recommends to the General Assembly the adoption of one
draft resolution, and in paragraph 10 of the same document,
the adoption of one draft decision.
In paragraph 5 of document A/53/608/Add.5, the
Second Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of one draft resolution under sub-item (e),
"Implementation of the Programme of Action for the Least
Developed Countries for the 1990s".
Document A/53/608/Add.6 contains the report of the
Second Committee on sub-item (f), "Implementation of
the Programme of Action of the International Conference
on Population and Development". Operative paragraphs
4 and 5 of the draft resolution on this sub-item should be
corrected by replacing "thirty-third" with "thirty-second".
The next session of the Commission on Population and
Development is the thirty-second session to be held in
March 1999. Paragraph 10 of that document recommends
to the General Assembly the adoption of one draft
resolution, and paragraph 11, the adoption of one draft
decision.
In paragraph 5 of document A/53/608/Add.7, the
Second Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of one draft resolution under sub-item (g),
"Cultural development".
The General Assembly also has before it the report
of
the
Second
Committee
on
item
entitled
"Environment and sustainable development", which is
contained in documents A/53/609 and Addenda 1 to 6.
Document A/53/609 contains the introduction to the
item and a list of documents before the Committee.
Under sub-item (a), entitled "Implementation of and
follow-up to the outcome of the United Nations
Conference on Environment and Development, including
the outcome of the nineteenth special session of the
General Assembly for the purpose of an overall review
and appraisal of the implementation of Agenda 21", the
Second
Committee,
in
paragraph
of
document
A/53/609/Add.1, recommends the adoption of one draft
resolution.
Under sub-item (b), entitled "Protection of global
climate for present and future generations of mankind",
the Assembly has before it document A/53/609/Add.2,
which contains, in paragraph 3, one draft decision
recommended for adoption.
In paragraph 6 of document A/53/609/Add.3,
submitted under sub-item (c), entitled "Implementation of
the outcome of the Global Conference on the Sustainable
Development of Small Island Developing States", the
Second Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of one draft resolution.
In paragraph 6 of document A/53/609/Add.4,
submitted under sub-item (d), entitled "Convention on
Biological Diversity", the Second Committee recommends
General Assembly
91st plenary meeting
Fifty-third session
15 December 1998
to the General Assembly the adoption of one draft
resolution.
In
paragraph
of
document
submitted under sub-item (e), entitled "Implementation of
the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification
in Those Countries Experiencing Serious Drought and/or
Desertification,
Particularly
in
Africa",
the
Second
Committee recommends to the General Assembly the
adoption of one draft resolution.
In paragraph 18 of document A/53/609/Add.6, the
Second Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of three draft resolutions which are not related
to a specific sub-item. In paragraph 19 of the same
document, the Second Committee recommends to the
General Assembly the adoption of one draft decision.
Under agenda item 95, entitled "Operational activities
for development", the Assembly has before it the report of
the Second Committee contained in document A/53/610. I
should like to bring to the attention of the General
Assembly three corrections to be made to this document.
First, in the third line of the first preambular paragraph of
draft resolution I, the word "and" should be deleted. In the
eighth line of paragraph 16 of draft resolution I, "board"
should read "boards". In the second line of paragraph 22 of
draft resolution I, "Nations" should read "Nations'".
With those corrections, the Second Committee
recommends to the General Assembly the adoption of two
draft resolutions contained in paragraph 13 and one draft
decision contained in paragraph 14 of document A/53/610.
The Assembly also has before it the report of the
Second Committee under agenda item 96, entitled "Training
and research", which is contained in document A/53/611.
Paragraph 14 of that document contains one draft resolution
under sub-item (a), "United Nations University"; and one
draft resolution under sub-item (b), "United Nations
Institute
for
Training
and
Research",
which
are
recommended for adoption by the General Assembly.
The Assembly also has before it document A/53/612,
which contains the report of the Second Committee on
agenda item 97, entitled "Permanent sovereignty of the
Palestinian people in the occupied Palestinian territory,
including Jerusalem, and of the Arab population in the
occupied Syrian Golan over their natural resources".
Paragraph 11 contains one draft resolution, which was
adopted by the Second Committee by a recorded vote and
is recommended to the Assembly for adoption.
Under agenda item 98, entitled "Implementation of
the first United Nations Decade for the Eradication of
Poverty (1997-2006)", the Assembly has before it the
report of the Second Committee contained in document
A/53/613. The Second Committee recommends to the
General Assembly the adoption of two draft resolutions
contained in paragraph 14 of that document and one draft
decision, which is contained in paragraph 15.
I should like to inform the General Assembly that,
during this session, the Second Committee adopted 36
draft substantive proposals. These proposals should be
considered to be significant contributions of the Second
Committee to the process of revitalization of the United
Nations activities in the economic and environmental
fields. The Committee tried to promote the establishment
of favourable conditions for the sustainable development
of all nations of the world, developed and developing,
economies
in
transition,
small
island
States
and
landlocked countries. We have come to agreement on 32
draft resolutions.
Now I should like to take this opportunity to thank
all the members of the Second Committee for their
contribution to the work of the Committee and to thank
the Chairman, Mr. Bagher Asadi, and the three Vice-
Chairmen, Mr. David Prendergast of Jamaica, Mr. Burak
Özügergin of Turkey and Mr. Odyek Agona of Uganda,
for their efforts in successfully completing the work of
the Committee. My thanks also go to the members of the
Secretariat for their assistance and endurance.
I have the honour to submit the reports of the
Second
Committee
to
the
General
Assembly
for
consideration.
The Acting President: The positions of delegations
regarding the recommendations of the Second Committee
have been made clear in the Committee and are reflected
in the relevant official records.
May I remind Members States that under paragraph
7 of decision 34/401, the General Assembly agreed that
"When the same draft resolution is considered
in a Main Committee and in plenary meeting, a
delegation should, as far as possible, explain its vote
only once, i.e., either in the Committee or in plenary
meeting unless that delegation's vote in plenary
meeting is different from its vote in the Committee."
General Assembly
91st plenary meeting
Fifty-third session
15 December 1998
May I also remind delegations that, also in accordance
with General Assembly decision 34/401, explanations of
vote are limited to 10 minutes and should be made by
delegations from their seats.
Before
we
begin
to
take
action
on
the
recommendations contained in the reports of the Second
Committee, I should like to advise representatives that we
are going to proceed to take decisions in the same manner
as was done in the Second Committee. This means that
where a recorded vote was taken, we will do the same,
unless the Secretariat has been notified otherwise in
advance.
I should also hope that we may proceed to adopt
without a vote the recommendations that were adopted
without a vote in the Second Committee.

text.b: Report of the Second Committee (A/53/606 and

page.text: The Acting President: May I take it that the General
Assembly wishes to take note of the report of the Second
Committee contained in document A/53/606?
The Acting President: We now turn to the draft
resolution recommended by the Second Committee in
paragraph
of
its
report
contained
in
document
The Second Committee adopted the draft resolution,
entitled "Role of the United Nations in promoting
development
in
the
context
of
globalization
and
interdependence". May I take it that it is the wish of the
General Assembly to do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution 53/169).
The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the two draft resolutions recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 10 of its report and on one
draft decision recommended by the Second Committee in
paragraph 11 of the same document.
The Assembly will turn first to draft resolution I,
entitled "International trade and development".
The Second Committee adopted draft resolution I.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to do the same?
Draft resolution I was adopted (resolution 53/170).
The Acting President: Draft resolution II is entitled
"Transit environment in the landlocked States in Central
Asia and their transit developing neighbours".
The Second Committee adopted draft resolution II.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to do likewise?
Draft resolution II was adopted (resolution 53/171).
The Acting President: We turn now to the draft
decision, entitled "Documents relating to trade and
development".
May I consider that the Assembly wishes to adopt
the draft decision as recommended by the Second
Committee?
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish
of
the
General
Assembly
to
conclude
its
consideration of sub-item (a) of agenda item 91?
General Assembly
91st plenary meeting
Fifty-third session
15 December 1998

text.b: (b) Financing of development, including net transfer of

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the two draft resolutions recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 10 of its report and on the
draft decision recommended by the Second Committee in
paragraph 11 of the same report.
The Assembly will first turn to draft resolution I,
entitled "The financial crisis and its impact on growth and
development, especially in the developing countries".
The Second Committee adopted draft resolution I.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to do the same?
Draft resolution I was adopted (resolution 53/172).
The Acting President: Draft resolution II is entitled
"High- level international intergovernmental consideration
of financing for development".
The Second Committee adopted draft resolution II.
May I take it that the General Assembly wishes to do the
same?
Draft resolution II was adopted (resolution 53/173).
The Acting President: We turn now to the draft
decision, entitled "Documents relating to the financing of
development".
May I take it that the General Assembly wishes to
adopt the draft decision?
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish of the General Assembly to conclude its consideration
of sub-item (b) of agenda item 91?
The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 7 of its report.
The Second Committee adopted the draft resolution.
May I consider that the Assembly wishes to do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the

General

to

The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 7 of its report.
The
draft
resolution
is
entitled
"Enhancing
international cooperation towards a durable solution to the
external debt problem of developing countries". May I
take it that the General Assembly wishes to adopt the
draft resolution as orally corrected by the Rapporteur?

text.i: The draft resolution as orally corrected was adopted

page.text: (resolution 53/175).
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish
of
the
General
Assembly
to
conclude
its
consideration of sub-item (d) of agenda item 91?
It was so decided.
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish of the Assembly to conclude its consideration of
agenda item 91 as a whole?
General Assembly
91st plenary meeting
Fifty-third session
15 December 1998
The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on two draft resolutions recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 14 of its report.
We turn first to draft resolution I, entitled "Action
against corruption and bribery in international commercial
transactions".
The Second Committee adopted draft resolution I.
May I take it that the General Assembly wishes to adopt
draft resolution I?
Draft resolution I was adopted (resolution 53/176).
The Acting President: We next turn to draft
resolution II, entitled "Industrial development cooperation".
The Second Committee adopted draft resolution II.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to adopt draft
resolution II?
Draft resolution II was adopted (resolution 53/177).
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish of the General Assembly to conclude its consideration
of agenda item 92?
Agenda item 93 (continued)
The Acting President: May I take it that the General
Assembly wishes to take note of the report of the Second
Committee as contained in document A/53/608?

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 10 of its report and on the
draft decision recommended by the Second Committee in
paragraph 11 of the same report.
We turn first to the draft resolution, entitled "Special
session of the General Assembly for an overall review and
appraisal of the implementation of the Habitat Agenda".
The Second Committee adopted the draft resolution.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution 53/180).
The Acting President: I now invite representatives to
turn to the draft decision, entitled "Report of the Secretary-
General on the assessment of the United Nations Centre for
Human Settlements".
The Second Committee adopted the draft decision.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to do likewise?
The draft decision was adopted.

wish of the Assembly to conclude its consideration of sub-
item (c) of agenda item 93?
The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 9 of its report and on the
draft decision recommended by the Second Committee in
paragraph 10 of the same report.
We turn first to the draft resolution, entitled "Renewal
of the dialogue on strengthening international economic
cooperation for development through partnership".
The Second Committee adopted the draft resolution.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution

draft decision, entitled "Documents relating to renewal of
the dialogue on strengthening international economic
cooperation for development through partnership".
The Second Committee adopted the draft decision.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to do likewise?
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish
of

Assembly
to

consideration of sub-item (d) of agenda item 93?

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 10 of its report and on the
draft decision recommended by the Second Committee in
paragraph 11 of the same report.
We turn first to the draft resolution, entitled
"Implementation of the Programme of Action of the
International Conference on Population and Development",
as orally corrected by the Rapporteur.
The Second Committee adopted the draft resolution.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to adopt the draft
resolution, as orally corrected by the Rapporteur?

text.i: The draft resolution, as orally corrected, was adopted

page.text: (resolution 53/183).
The Acting President: We shall now turn to the draft
decision,
entitled
"Commemoration
of
the
thirtieth
anniversary of the United Nations Population Fund".
The Second Committee adopted the draft decision.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to do likewise?
The Acting President: The General Assembly has
thus concluded this stage of its consideration of sub-item (f)
of agenda item 93.
The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 5 of its report.
The Second Committee adopted the draft resolution.
May I take it that the Assembly wishes to do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution 53/184).
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish
of
the
General
Assembly
to
conclude
its
consideration of sub-item (g) of agenda item 93?

text.b: Report of the Second Committee (A/53/609 and

page.text: The Acting President: May I take it that the
General Assembly wishes to take note of the report of the
Second Committee on agenda item 94 contained in
document A/53/609?
The Acting President: We now turn to the draft
resolutions recommended by the Second Committee in
paragraph 18 of its report contained in document
A/53/609/Add.6 and on the draft decision recommended by
the Second Committee in paragraph 19 of the same
report.
The Second Committee adopted draft resolution I,
entitled "International cooperation to reduce the impact of
the El Niño phenomenon". May I take it that the
Assembly decides to do the same?
Draft resolution I was adopted (resolution 53/185).
The Acting President: The Second Committee
adopted
draft
resolution
II,
entitled
"International
institutional arrangements related to environment and
development". May I take it that the Assembly decides to
do the same?
Draft resolution II was adopted (resolution 53/186).
The Acting President: The Second Committee
adopted draft resolution III, entitled "Report of the
Governing Council of the United Nations Environment
Programme". May I take it that the Assembly decides to
do the same?
Draft resolution III was adopted (resolution 53/187).
General Assembly
91st plenary meeting
Fifty-third session
15 December 1998
The Acting President: We turn now to the draft
decision, entitled "Report of the Secretary-General on
products harmful to health and the environment".
May I take it that it is the wish of the General
Assembly to adopt the draft decision as recommended by
the Second Committee?

text.b: Implementation of and follow-up to the outcome of
the United Nations Conference on Environment
and Development, including the outcome of the
nineteenth special session of the General Assembly
for the purpose of an overall review and appraisal

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 6 of its report.
The draft resolution is entitled "Implementation of and
follow-up to the outcome of the United Nations Conference
on Environment and Development and the nineteenth
special session of the General Assembly".
The Second Committee adopted the draft resolution.
May I consider that the Assembly wishes to do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution 53/188).
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish of the Assembly to conclude its consideration of sub-
item (a) of agenda item 94?

text.b: (b) Protection of global climate for present and future

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft decision recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 3 of its report.
The draft decision, entitled "Report of the Executive
Secretary of the United Nations Framework Convention on
Climate Change", was adopted by the Second Committee.
May I consider that the Assembly wishes to adopt the
draft decision as recommended by the Committee?
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish
of
the
General
Assembly
to
conclude
its
consideration of sub-item (b) of agenda item 94?

text.b: Implementation of the outcome of the Global
Conference on the Sustainable Development of

page.text: The Acting President: I will now call on those
representatives
who
wish
to
make
statements
in
explanation of position before action is taken on the draft
resolution recommended by the Second Committee in
paragraph 6 of its report.
Mr. Rønneberg (Marshall Islands): At the outset, I
wish to thank the Rapporteur of the Second Committee
for his hard work and for his reports to the General
Assembly.
The convening next year of a special session to
review the implementation of the Barbados Conference is
of extreme importance to the Republic of the Marshall
Islands, and indeed to all small island developing States.
For this reason, my delegation is extremely disappointed
that the Second Committee could not find an equitable
solution to the issue of the representation of those States
which are not Members of the United Nations.
As the draft resolution is currently drafted, these
States will be able to be present only as observers, even
though they are independent and sovereign States and did
participate as full members in the Barbados Conference
itself. My delegation sees this as further evidence of the
increasing marginalization of small island developing
States, and we deeply regret that the General Assembly is
about to endorse this state of affairs.
My delegation has regretfully decided to accept the
consensus which has been forced on us by a minority in
the Committee for reasons that we believe were unrelated
to the particular draft resolution. We have been forced to
General Assembly
91st plenary meeting
Fifty-third session
15 December 1998
accept this consensus for the sake of retaining other
important aspects of the draft resolution.
My delegation will work closely with the delegations
of the small island developing States affected by the
situation so that their participation in the special session and
in its preparatory process will be more meaningful than that
which has been envisaged by the small minority.
Ms. Hawkins (Australia): Australia is pleased to have
been
a
sponsor
of
the
draft
resolution
on
the
implementation of the outcome of the Global Conference on
the Sustainable Development of Small Island Developing
States.
We wish, however, to register our disappointment that
the draft resolution was not able to ensure the full
participation of small island developing States that are not
Members of the United Nations in the special session
review of the Barbados Programme of Action, despite great
efforts by several fellow sponsors to find a solution, which
we greatly appreciate.
We would nonetheless request that all will be done to
facilitate the participation of small island developing States
that are not United Nations Members to the fullest extent
possible to ensure a successful review.
The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 6 of its report.
The Second Committee adopted the draft resolution.
May I consider that the Assembly wishes to do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution 53/189).
The Acting President: The General Assembly has
thus concluded this stage of its consideration of sub-item
(c) of agenda item 94.
The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second
Committee
in
paragraph
of
its
report
The Second Committee adopted the draft resolution.
May I consider that the Assembly wishes to do likewise?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution

wish
of
the
General

to

consideration of sub-item (d) of agenda item 94?

conclude
its
consideration of sub-item (e) of agenda item 94?
The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the two draft resolutions recommended by
the Second Committee in paragraph 13 of its report
(A/53/610) and on the draft decision recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 14 of the same report.
We turn first to draft resolution I, entitled "Triennial
policy review of operational activities for development of
the United Nations system", as orally corrected by the
Rapporteur.
General Assembly
91st plenary meeting
Fifty-third session
15 December 1998
Draft resolution I was adopted by the Second
Committee. May I take it that the General Assembly wishes
to adopt draft resolution I, as orally corrected by the
Rapporteur?

text.i: Draft resolution I, as orally corrected, was adopted

page.text: (resolution 53/192).
The Acting President: Draft resolution II, entitled
"Preparations for the special session of the General
Assembly in the year 2001 to review the achievement of
the goals of the World Summit for Children", was adopted
by the Second Committee. May I take it that the Assembly
too wishes to adopt draft resolution II?
Draft resolution II was adopted (resolution 53/193).
The Acting President: We turn now to the draft
decision, entitled "Documents relating to operational
activities for development". May I consider that the
Assembly wishes to adopt the draft decision?
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish of the General Assembly to conclude its consideration
of agenda item 95?

text.b: (b) United Nations Institute for Training and Research

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the two draft resolutions recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 14 of its report (A/53/611).
Draft
resolution
I,
entitled
"United
Nations
University", was adopted by the Second Committee. May
I consider that the Assembly too wishes to adopt the draft
resolution?
Draft resolution I was adopted (resolution 53/194).
The Acting President: Draft resolution II, entitled
"United Nations Institute for Training and Research", was
adopted by the Second Committee. May I consider that
the Assembly wishes to adopt the draft resolution?
Draft resolution II was adopted (resolution 53/195).
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish
of
the
General
Assembly
to
conclude
its
consideration of agenda item 96?

and of the Arab population in the occupied Syrian

decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 11 of its report

text.i: The draft resolution was adopted by 144 votes to 2,

page.text: with 12 abstentions (resolution 53/196).
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish of the General Assembly to conclude its consideration
of agenda item 97?

text.b: Implementation of the first United Nations Decade for

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the two draft resolutions recommended by the
Second Committee in paragraph 14 of its report (A/53/613)
and on the draft decision recommended by the Second
Committee in paragraph 15 of the same report.
I call on the representative of Bangladesh, who wishes
to speak in explanation of position before action is taken on
these texts.
Mr. Sorcar (Bangladesh): At the 31st meeting of the
Second Committee, held on 2 November 1998, the Under-
Secretary-General for Economic and Social Affairs, Mr.
Nitin Desai, made a statement to introduce and explain
the report of the Secretary-General on the role of
microcredit in the eradication of poverty, documents
A/53/223 and A/53/223/Add.1. The text of that statement
was subsequently issued on 15 November 1998 annexed
to a note by the Secretariat, document A/C.2/53/7. That
document elaborates some of the points in the report of
the Secretary-General; it should be viewed as an integral
part of that report, and the two should be considered
together.
The preference of the Bangladesh delegation would
have been to appropriately adjust the text of the draft
decision recommended in paragraph 15 of document
A/53/613 to take this into account. However, owing to
time constraints, we went along with the decision to
recommend the draft decision to the Assembly. At the
same time, however, we would like the General Assembly
to
take
note
both
of
documents
and
A/53/223/Add.1 and of document A/C.2/53/7.
The Acting President: We turn first to draft
resolution I, entitled "International Year of Microcredit,
Draft resolution I was adopted by the Second
Committee without a vote. May I take it that the
Assembly too wishes to adopt the draft resolution?
Draft resolution I was adopted (resolution 53/197).
The Acting President: The Second Committee
adopted draft resolution II, entitled "Implementation of
the first United Nations Decade for the Eradication of
Poverty", without a vote. May I take it that the Assembly
wishes to do likewise?
Draft resolution II was adopted (resolution 53/198).
The Acting President: We turn now to the draft
decision, entitled "Report of the Secretary-General on the
role of microcredit in the eradication of poverty".
May I take it that the General Assembly wishes to
adopt the draft decision as recommended by the Second
Committee?
General Assembly
91st plenary meeting
Fifty-third session
15 December 1998
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish of the General Assembly to conclude its consideration
of agenda item 98?
Agenda item 12 (continued)

text.b: Report of the Economic and Social Council

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now
proceed to take a decision on the three draft resolutions
recommended by the Second Committee in paragraph 18 of
its report and on the two draft decisions recommended by
the Second Committee in paragraph 19 of the same report.
I shall put the recommendations of the Second
Committee to the Assembly one by one. After all the
decisions have been taken, representatives will again have
the opportunity to explain their votes or positions.
We
turn
first
to
draft
resolution
I,
entitled
"Proclamation of international years", which the Second
Committee adopted. May I take it that the General
Assembly wishes to do likewise?
Draft resolution I was adopted (resolution 53/199).
The Acting President: The Second Committee
adopted draft resolution II, entitled "Proclamation of 2002
as the International Year of Ecotourism". May I take it that
the Assembly wishes to do the same?
Draft resolution II was adopted (resolution 53/200).
The Acting President: The Second Committee
adopted draft resolution III, entitled "Public administration
and development". May I take it that the General
Assembly wishes to do likewise?
Draft resolution III was adopted (resolution 53/201).
The Acting President: We will now turn to the two
draft decisions recommended by the Second Committee
in paragraph 19 of its report.
Draft decision I is entitled "Documents relating to
the report of the Economic and Social Council".
May I take it that the General Assembly wishes to
adopt draft decision I?
The Acting President: Draft decision II is entitled
"Biennial programme of work of the Second Committee
May I take it that the General Assembly wishes to
adopt draft decision II?
The Acting President: May I take it that it is the
wish
of
the
General
Assembly
to
conclude
its
consideration of the chapters of the report of the
Economic and Social Council allocated to the Second
Committee?
The Acting President: The General Assembly has
thus concluded its consideration of all the reports of the
Second Committee before it.
